00098 /*
00099 ** Reset Variables type
00100 */
00101 typedef struct
00102 {
00103    uint32     ResetType;
00104    uint32     ResetSubtype;
00105    uint32     BootSource;
00106    uint32     ES_CausedReset;
00107    uint32     ProcessorResetCount;
00108    uint32     MaxProcessorResetCount;
00109       
00110 } CFE_ES_ResetVariables_t;
00111 
00112 /*
00113 ** Debug variables type
00114 */
00115 typedef struct
00116 {  
00117    uint32 DebugFlag;
00118    uint32 WatchdogWriteFlag;
00119    uint32 PrintfEnabledFlag;
00120    uint32 LastAppId;
00121    
00122 } CFE_ES_DebugVariables_t;
00123 
00124 /*
00125 ** Exception and Reset Log Structure
00126 */
00127 typedef struct
00128 {
00129      uint32                  LogEntryType;                  /* What type of log entry */
00130      uint32                  ResetType;                     /* Main cause for the reset */
00131      uint32                  ResetSubtype;                  /* The sub-type for the reset */
00132      uint32                  BootSource;                    /* The boot source  */
00133      uint32                  ProcessorResetCount;           /* The number of processor resets */
00134      uint32                  MaxProcessorResetCount;        /* The maximum number before a Power On */
00135      CFE_ES_DebugVariables_t DebugVars;                     /* ES Debug variables */
00136      CFE_TIME_SysTime_t      TimeCode;                      /* Time code */
00137      char                    Description[80];               /* The ascii data for the event */
00138      uint32                  ContextIsPresent;                  /* Indicates the context data is valid */
00139      uint32                  AppID;                          /* The application ID */
00140      uint8                   Context[CFE_PSP_CPU_CONTEXT_SIZE];  /* cpu  context */
00141 
00142 } CFE_ES_ERLog_t;
00143 
00144 /*
00145 ** CFE_ES_GenCounterRecord_t is an internal structure used to keep track of
00146 ** Generic Counters that are active in the system.
00147 */
00148 typedef struct
00149 {
00150    boolean        RecordUsed;                     /* Is the record used(1) or available(0) ? */
00151    uint32         Counter;                        /* The type of App: CORE or EXTERNAL */
00152    char           CounterName[OS_MAX_API_NAME];   /* Counter Name */      
00153 } CFE_ES_GenCounterRecord_t;
00154 
00155 
00156 /*
00157 ** Executive Services Global Memory Data
00158 ** This is the regular global data that is not preserved on a 
00159 **  processor reset.
00160 */
00161 typedef struct
00162 {
00163    /*
00164    ** Debug Variables
00165    */
00166    CFE_ES_DebugVariables_t DebugVars;
00167    
00168    /*
00169    ** Shared Data Semaphore
00170    */
00171    uint32 SharedDataMutex;
00172    
00173    /*
00174    ** Startup Sync variables.
00175    */
00176    uint32  AppStartedCount;
00177    uint32  AppReadyCount;
00178    uint32  SystemState;
00179 
00180    /*
00181    ** ES Task Table
00182    */ 
00183    uint32              RegisteredTasks;
00184    CFE_ES_TaskRecord_t TaskTable[OS_MAX_TASKS];
00185 
00186    /*
00187    ** ES App Table
00188    */
00189    uint32             RegisteredCoreApps;
00190    uint32             RegisteredExternalApps;
00191    CFE_ES_AppRecord_t AppTable[CFE_ES_MAX_APPLICATIONS];
00192    
00193    /*
00194    ** ES Shared Library Table
00195    */
00196    uint32             RegisteredLibs;
00197    CFE_ES_LibRecord_t LibTable[CFE_ES_MAX_LIBRARIES];
00198 
00199    /*
00200    ** ES Generic Counters Table
00201    */
00202    CFE_ES_GenCounterRecord_t CounterTable[CFE_ES_MAX_GEN_COUNTERS];
00203 
00204    /*
00205    ** Critical Data Store Management Variables
00206    */
00207    CFE_ES_CDSVariables_t CDSVars;
00208 
00209 } CFE_ES_Global_t;
00210 
00211 /*
00212 ** Executive Services Global Reset Data type
00213 ** This is the special memory area for ES that is preserved
00214 ** on a processor reset.
00215 */
00216 typedef struct
00217 {
00218    /*
00219    ** Exception and Reset log declaration
00220    */
00221    CFE_ES_ERLog_t    ERLog[CFE_ES_ER_LOG_ENTRIES];
00222    uint32            ERLogIndex;
00223    uint32            ERLogEntries;
00224    uint32            LastAppId;
00225 
00226    /*
00227    ** System Log declaration
00228    */
00229    char            SystemLog[CFE_ES_SYSTEM_LOG_SIZE];
00230    uint32          SystemLogIndex;
00231    uint32          SystemLogMode;
00232    uint32          SystemLogEntryNum;
00233  
00234    /*
00235    ** Performance Data
00236    */
00237    CFE_ES_PerfData_t       Perf;
00238  
00239    /*
00240    ** Reset Variables
00241    */
00242    CFE_ES_ResetVariables_t  ResetVars;
00243 
00244    /*
00245    ** Time variables that are 
00246    ** preserved on a processor reset
00247    */ 
00248    CFE_TIME_ResetVars_t TimeResetVars;
00249 
00250    #ifdef CFE_EVS_LOG_ON
00251       /*
00252       ** EVS Log and associated variables. This needs to be preserved on a processor reset.
00253       */
00254       CFE_EVS_Log_t              EVS_Log;
00255    #endif
00256 
00257 } CFE_ES_ResetData_t;
